entry.title: Lindsay Lohan Says Nothing is Off-Limits for SNL

link.Abstract: According to TMZ, Lindsay Lohan is giving Saturday Night Live free reign this weekend.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Lohan has been dying (morgue pun intended) to revive her fading career, and personally reached out to Lorne Michaels to make the SNL hookup happen.

link.Abstract: Lindsay Lohan’s latest court visit proved the actress is meeting the terms of her probation. According to the judge, she’s “in the home stretch” of her sentence.

link.Abstract: While attending an amfAR gala in New York, Lindsay Lohan asked a "Canadian financier" to buy her a $20,000 watch. He laughed her request off, according to reports.

link.Abstract: According to a lawsuit, Lindsay Lohan allegedly drove a rented Maserati into a woman pushing a stroller.
link.title: Nanny Sues Lindsay Lohan Over Alleged Hit-and-Run

link.Abstract: Actress Lindsay Lohan made another appearance in court Jan. 17, 2012, this time for a progress report hearing after pleading no contest to a misdemeanor count of theft involving a necklace in Los Angeles, Calif.

link.Abstract: According to reports, Lindsay Lohan may be coming north.
link.title: Could Canada Prevent Lindsay Lohan from Playing Elizabeth Taylor?

link.Abstract: Lindsay Lohan has something to celebrate: according to reports, she's met the demands of her probation in time for Tuesday's court hearing. Would that explain why she's been out partying at various Golden Globes events?
link.title: Lindsay Lohan Crashes Golden Globe Parties, Heads to Court Tuesday

link.Abstract: Hugh Hefner says that he was initially hesitant about having Lindsay Lohan pose for Playboy. The magazine's founder also revealed he came up with the idea for her Marilyn Monroe-referencing pictorial.
link.title: Hugh Hefner Claims Responsibility For Lindsay Lohan's Cliche Playboy Spread (Sorry For All the Snark, Linds!)

link.Abstract: Lindsay Lohan didn't leave Hawaii in time to make her much-publicized interview with Ellen DeGeneres, but with luck she'll still make her Wednesday court date.
link.title: Lindsay Lohan Misses Ellen Interview, Returns to L.A. In Time For Jay-Z and Kanye West Concert (And, Fingers Crossed, Court Date)

link.Abstract: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter
link.title: Follow Dose.ca on Twitter

content.div:
Are Saturday Night Live viewers going to be treated to skits about Lindsay Lohan’s fire crotch and sticky fingers? It’s possible. According to sources close to the actress, nothing is off limits when she hosts this weekend’s episode.

TMZ reports that the actress is game to mock herself on the show, where she's been the butt of jokes for years.

According to the site, Lohan has been dying (morgue pun intended) to revive her fading career, and personally reached out to Lorne Michaels to make the SNL hookup happen.

TMZ reports that Lohan wants to steal the show (yes, bad necklace joke intended) and let everyone to know she's "in on the joke," so she’s not putting restrictions on the writers. (Ten bucks says she’ll be presenting the opening monologue in either an orange jumpsuit or a Marilyn Monroe wig. ) Her biggest feat, however, will be to get everyone to laugh with her, not at her.

link.Abstract: Lindsay Lohan’s latest court visit proved the actress is meeting the terms of her probation. According to the judge, she’s “in the home stretch” of her sentence.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Judge Stephanie Sautner was pleased with Lohan's effort during her probation period, impressed that the actress completed her latest round of community service and therapy.

entry.title: Photos: Lindsay Lohan Back in Court

link.Abstract: Actress Lindsay Lohan made another appearance in court Jan. 17, 2012, this time for a progress report hearing after pleading no contest to a misdemeanor count of theft involving a necklace in Los Angeles, Calif.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Lindsay Lohan sits in court for her probation update hearing with her attorney Shawn Chapman Holley, left, at the Airport Courthouse, Tuesday, January 17, 2012, in Los Angeles, California. Los Angeles Superior Judge Stephanie Sautner said Lohan had met her required 12 sessions of community service at the L.A. County morgue and mandatory therapy sessions and is on pace to end probation in March if she completes her 60 days of community service.
link.title: Lindsay Lohan

link.Abstract: "Just keep doing what you're doing, and you appear to be doing it well," Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Stephanie Sautner told Lohan at the hearing.
link.title: Lindsay Lohan "doing well" on probation

link.Abstract: According to reports, Lindsay Lohan may be coming north.
link.title: Could Canada Prevent Lindsay Lohan from Playing Elizabeth Taylor?
